summary: This document is an FBI investigative report (likely a 302) summarizing a call from a Confidential Informant (CI) on July 29, 2019. The CI provides detailed information about Jeffrey Epstein's financial and political activities in the U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI), including alleged campaign finance violations, property ownership, business associates, and connections to local political figures. The report also includes embedded public updates on Epstein's 2019 federal criminal case in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the federal indictment for sex trafficking and the CI's allegations regarding financial and political activities in the USVI, including campaign contributions and property ownership.

persons.name: Sebastiano Cassinelli Paiewonsky
persons.context: An attorney in St. Thomas who allegedly received wires from Epstein for the Bryan/Roach campaign, set up through a 501(c)(4) fund. Also involved in other Epstein-related transactions in the VI.

persons.name: Marcello Piacento
persons.context: Mentioned as the broker involved in an insurance settlement related to Epstein's properties.

persons.name: Garrett Jones
persons.context: A man from New York who represents Epstein for local transactions in the USVI, including insurance settlements and purchases.

persons.name: John P. de Jongh, Jr.
persons.role: Former Governor of USVI / Business Partner
persons.context: Former Governor of the USVI who, as a partner with Epstein, purchased the Nisky Shopping Center in St. Thomas.

persons.name: John A. Engerman
persons.role: Managing Member of BDO USVI / Campaign Manager
persons.context: Head of BDO USVI, campaign manager for Governor Albert Bryan's 2018 campaign, and a partner in the firm managing USVI disaster recovery funds. The CI alleges he was part of the campaign funding structure.

persons.name: Katherine Gibson
persons.role: Former Managing Member of BDO USVI
persons.context: Stepped down as managing member of BDO USVI but remained on staff when John Engerman was appointed.

persons.name: Val Collens
persons.context: Former Commissioner of the VI Department of Finance who allegedly had a personal interest in the questionable bidding process for the Single Audit Contract awarded to BDO USVI.

persons.name: Fernando Scherrer
persons.role: Former Managing Partner of BDO Puerto Rico
persons.context: Arrested as part of a federal indictment in Puerto Rico for wire fraud, conspiracy, and money laundering. Was the superior to John Engerman and a licensed CPA in the USVI, causing complications for BDO VI.

persons.name: Janice Hodge
persons.role: Chair of the USVI CPA Board
persons.context: Chair of the CPA Board whom John Engerman called to inform about the developments regarding Fernando Scherrer's arrest.

persons.name: Albert Bryan
persons.context: Governor of the USVI, close friend and confidant of John Engerman, who was his campaign manager. His campaign (Bryan/Roach) is alleged to have received funds from Epstein.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: The judge presiding over the federal case 'United States v. Jeffrey Epstein' in the Southern District of New York, mentioned in the embedded case updates.

persons.name: Wendy Olsen
persons.context: Victim/Witness Coordinator for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, listed as a contact for victims in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Anna H. Paiewonsky
persons.context: An attorney in St. Thomas mentioned as part of the campaign and funding controlled through the special 501(c)(4) fund.

connections.description: Epstein allegedly wired over $380,000 to the Bryan/Roach campaign through Paiewonsky, who set up a 501(c)(4) fund to receive the money.
Partners in the purchase of the Nisky Shopping Center in St. Thomas, VI.
Jones represents Epstein for local transactions in the USVI, including insurance settlements and purchases.
Engerman was the campaign manager for Governor Albert Bryan's 2018 campaign and is described as his close friend and confidant.
Engerman's superior at BDO; Scherrer was the head of USVI operations. Scherrer's arrest created a dilemma for BDO VI.
The CI alleges Engerman, as part of the Bryan/Roach campaign structure, was connected to funds controlled through a 501(c)(4) that received Epstein's wires.

events.title: Epstein Indictment Unsealed
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office unsealed federal felony charges against Jeffrey Epstein for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Initial Presentment and Arraignment
events.description: Epstein's initial presentment and arraignment was held. He consented to detention pending a bail hearing.

events.title: Bail Hearing Continuation
events.description: Continuation of a bail hearing was held. The court heard arguments and reserved decision.

events.title: Status Conference / Bail Ruling
events.description: A status conference was held where the court ruled Epstein would be incarcerated pending trial.

events.title: Alleged Campaign Finance Violations
events.description: The CI alleges Jeffrey Epstein wired over $380,000 to the Bryan/Roach campaign during 2018 (and possibly 2019) through a 501(c)(4) fund set up by an attorney for Sebastiano Paiewonsky.

events.title: Hotel Funding Approval
events.description: Sebastiano Paiewonsky received approval for $10 million from the Chamber of Commerce to partially fund building a new hotel at Yacht Haven Grande in St. Thomas.

locations: Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York
American Yacht Harbor, Red Hook, St. Thomas, VI
Nisky Shopping Center, St. Thomas, VI
Yacht Haven Grande, St. Thomas, VI
St. James Property (likely Little St. James Island, USVI)
keyFacts: A Confidential Informant alleged that Jeffrey Epstein wired over $380,000 to the 2018 Bryan/Roach gubernatorial campaign in the US Virgin Islands through attorney Sebastiano Cassinelli Paiewonsky, using a 501(c)(4) social welfare organization fund.

Epstein owned significant property and businesses in the USVI, including half of American Yacht Harbor, a boat, AH Riise, Isidor Paiewonsky Association Inc., and was a partner with former Governor John de Jongh in purchasing the Nisky Shopping Center.

John A. Engerman, the campaign manager for Governor Albert Bryan and head of BDO USVI, is implicated in the CI's report regarding the campaign funding structure and his firm's lucrative government contracts for disaster recovery.

The document contains embedded public updates from July 2019 detailing the progression of Epstein's federal criminal case in New York, including his indictment, arraignment, bail hearings, and detention order.

The CI's report connects Epstein's financial network in the USVI to local political figures and raises questions about potential campaign finance violations and the use of 501(c)(4) organizations for political purposes.
